casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Andrew Darrin RAMSEUR 388A10-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 29, 2016 Daniel Shatz, Assistant Appellate Defender, Benjamin Dowling-Sendor, Assistant Appellate Defender, Andrew DeSimone, Assistant Appellate Defender, Glenn Gerding, Appellate Defender, for Ramseur, Andrew Darrin. Robert C. Montgomery, Special Deputy Attorney General, Amy Kunstling Irene, Special Deputy Attorney General, Jonathan Babb, Special Deputy Attorney General, Sarah Kirkman, District Attorney, for State of N.C. Cassandra Stubbs, Attorney at Law, Christopher A. Brook, Legal Director, Burton Craige, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, James Coleman, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, for ACLU Capital Punishment Project, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 26th of August 2016 by ACLU Capital Punishment Project, ACLU of NC Legal Foundation, NC Advocates for Justice, and NC Conference of the NAACP for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of August 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
